reviews.text: We came here with our 2 1/2 mo old infant for a week long vacation. The resort area was very quiet and relaxing. The views are just amazing and soothing. The rooms were absolutely beautiful. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and the bathrooms were well done! We had trouble with the hot water and maintenance staff came to adjust it as soon as we called. The area around the resort is very well maintained and super nice to take a nice walk early in the morning or late afternoon when it isn't so hot. We went in the summer, so it gets really hot during the day. The resort is a short drive to downtown. Definitely recommended for a nice relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Amazing views and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our studio was clean and comfortable, but not enough bedding for January. We chose to listen to a tour presentation, but Karen didn't want to present she wanted to force a sale. The reception for my tablet was very slow.
reviews.title: Enjoying Sedona once again

reviews.text: Our recent stay became an early Christmas for someone employed at the Sedona Summit. We have to relocate to another room after arriving due to the fireplace not working. I left my $1K camera/case and 2 lenses in the closet of our 1st room and of course it was NOT there the next morning when we discovered it was missing and not moved along with our original belongings.
reviews.title: Protect your Valuables
Like an... Upscale "Extended Stay"
reviews.text: Police report filed, etc and letter requesting reimbursement was sent to Diamond International and all they did was send me back the registration form we signed, stating that they are not responsible for lost property. To save face, they should have reimbursed us for at least the depreciated value of my camera. Again. Protect your valuables. The front office staff was very uncaring regarding our loss as well.

Many places boast of spa ameneties, but Sedona is all about magical views. The Sedona Summit is surrounded by views you can literally walk out your door and walk into the sunset! trails fromt he Mesa Suites and the Sunset suites can take you all way to one one the most famous vortex locations, Boynton Canyon, or is you want to hike and munch, to the stunning Enchantment resort. Now, it would take you all day to go that far, but what a day it would be!!!. A closer stroll---about 1 mile round trip, takes you to a scenic overlook that has panoramic views and legends that identify each peak and point of interest, including historic Jerome, Cottonwood, and Mingus Mountain.
reviews.title: the VERY BEST Place to stay in Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is restful to stay in luxurious rooms, walk out the door to hike or hot tub, then watch the snow filter down on the red rocks. Perfect winter wonderland vacation spot.
reviews.title: Great Location with Great Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Sedona Summit for Thanksgiving in 2011 and for Christmas in 2012. The resort is located outside the downtown, surrounded by the redrock formations. The location is very convenient for all the great places to eat in sedona and also some of the best hikes. The units are tastefully decorated, the grounds perfectly attended to, and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. A wonderful all arond spot to stay - we look forward to our next stay.
reviews.title: Sedona Summit - NicePlace

reviews.text: My wife and I rented a 1 bedroom with full kitchen in mid-December. We asked in advance for a "room with a view" as suggested by others on Tripadvisor. Well we got a room with a view of the highway, Other than that, the room was very nice. We did not get a jetted bathtub as others have mentioned. The unit was large and had 2 flat screens. The bed and pillows very comfortable. The resort had several heated pools and hot tubs which we did not use. The kitchen was nice also and had every utensil needed. It was a beautiful location and many units had great views of the red rocks.
reviews.title: Sedona Summit Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no free wifi anywhere. There are 2 PCs with internet where you check-in, but they always seemed to be taken. You can pay for wifi at a cost of $7 a day, We passed.
reviews.title: Great Resort for couples or family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Summit Resort and enjoyed our 10 day stay.
reviews.title: My wife and I stayed at ...

reviews.text: - comfortable accommodations and all the expected conveniences of resort living.
reviews.title: Beautiful place to stay

reviews.text: - very close to Sedona shopping and dining.
reviews.title: Pleasant Property but Mixed Experience

reviews.text: - beautiful scenery and close to amphitheater park for fantastic sunset views.
reviews.title: Nice, but disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one week in an efficiency unit. It was super clean and the grounds were very well maintained. The units have everything you might need including shampoo, towels, extra blankets, blowdryer, ironing board, coffemaker, and a much appreciated little room safe for valuables. The efficiency units do not have a washer and dryer.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We avoided the restaurants in Sedona which we found to be expensive for what was being served and not all that good. Instead, we shopped for groceries at the 2 health food stores and made our meals in the unit's little kitchen. It was well stocked with everything you might need except for sharp knives. You can certainly make dinner for 2 very easily. There is even a dishwasher.
reviews.title: Red Rock views at Sedona Summit

reviews.text: We toured gorgeous Sedona and Flagstaff, went to the Grand Canyon, hiked, saw Meteor Crater, the Petrified Forest and toured Taliesin West on our way back to Phoenix to catch our night flight home. A really great vacation. We were really tired when we got home though!
reviews.title: Beautiful and relaxing resort

reviews.text: Over Thanksgiving week we got to spend time in Sedona. Our timeshare exchange to the Sedona Summit was a great exchange in quality and value. We appreciated the friendly staff, the well maintained unit and grounds, plus the small but adequate gym on the property. The one bedroom unit was spacious and full kitchen allowed us feel right at home. Flat screens and wifi for purchase worked well in the unit. We appreciated the staffs consideration and assistance during our stay. All of this was excellent. The location was easy to find and easy to access all the sites and experiences Sedona and the surrounding area has to offer.
reviews.title: Great place in a great place

reviews.text: Our one and only regret was accepting the invitation to the VIP check in. Although all of that was nice with food and beverages our check-in left us feeling obligated to attend the presentation held two days later. We advise anyone not wishing to be sold a new week at a timeshare or points, decline the VIP check in and go straight to the main counter to check in. We were told the presentation would be 90min. and a tour etc. Yes, there was a tour of the facilities and a pitch and although THEY wouldn't call it pressure after we had upfront told them we were not buying any more vacation time, 2 and 1/2 hours later we walked out with our incentive. We may go back to a Diamond Resort property, but never sit thru another presentation...no matter what incentive they are offering.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, and comfortable
